intro: Viguiera pusilla var. astephana, commonly known as the Mexican paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it produces fluffy, white seed heads that are adapted for wind pollination. Viguiera pusilla var. astephana is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
